intro: Selago lychnidea, commonly known as the golden star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a slight blue or gray tint. Selago lychnidea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
